title: Rams officially hire Sean McVay as youngest head coach in NFL history
text:
Rams officially hire Sean McVay as youngest head coach in NFL history Rams officially hire Sean McVay as youngest head coach in NFL history By Bryan Kalbrosky 5 hours ago 305 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 5 hours ago 
The Los Angeles Rams have officially hired Washington offensive coordinator Sean McVay, who is just 30, as their next head coach. 
He was the Tampa Bay Buccaneers wide receivers coach in 2008 under Jon Gruden. Related: Jon Gruden gave Rams organizational assessment; did he discuss McVay? 
McVay most recently coached as the offensive coordinator of Washington. He had been with that organization since 2010, so he’s not exactly new to the coaching world. 
Lane Kiffin was 31 when he was hired as the Oakland Raiders head coach, so he’s not shockingly young either. 
But as Chris Burke noted on Twitter, McVay was born the same year that former Rams coach Jeff Fisher officially started his coaching career. That should add some necessary perspective. Sean McVay was born in 1986, the same year that Jeff Fisher started his coaching career as a DBs coach in Philadelphia. 
— Chris Burke (@ChrisBurke_SI) January 12, 2017 
He is younger than defensive players William Hayes and Eugene Sims ( via Greg Beachem ). 
The new Rams coach is also the grandson of John McVay, who was the GM of the San Francisco 49ers and a former New York Giants head coach. Related: Rams coach candidate Sean McVay lists Wade Phillips as top pick for DC 
As head coach, McVay would like to bring Broncos assistant Wade Phillips as his defensive coordinator. 
It’s unclear as of now who he would want to bring in as offensive coordinator or if he wants a new general manager to replace Les Snead. Keep an eye on Wade Phillips as the DC for the #Rams and new coach Sean McVay. Would have a top OC (McVay) and top DC (Wade). 
— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 12, 2017 Related:
